title: gdb: off by one line in latest head
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.
1. Build a very simple program (http://play.golang.org/p/F1l_1JJ-nH) as `go build
-gcflags "-N -l" simple.go`
2. Run it in gdb: `gdb simple`. Set a breakpoint on the first line (line 8).
3. Ask gdb to run it ('r'), then step over the lines ('n', 'n')

What is the expected output?
8               fmt.Println("one")
(gdb) n
one
9               fmt.Println("two")
(gdb) n
two
10              fmt.Println("three")
(gdb) n
three


What do you see instead?
8               fmt.Println("one")
(gdb) n
runtime.main () at /home/graham/src/go/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:224
224             mainÂ·init();
(gdb) finish
Run till exit from #0  runtime.main () at /home/graham/src/go/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:224
one

Breakpoint 1, main.main () at /home/graham/simple.go:8
8               fmt.Println("one")
(gdb) n
two
9               fmt.Println("two")
(gdb) n
three
10              fmt.Println("three")

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
6g

Which operating system are you using?
Ubuntu 13.10

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go version devel +b29b14df7e45 Sun Feb 16 20:46:03 2014 +1100 linux/amd64

gdb is 7.6.1-ubuntu

Please provide any additional information below.
There seems to be two problems:
- A breakpoint on the first line goes into proc.c
- gdb thinks we're one line before where we really are

This does not happen with Go 1.2

Original report and confirmation here:
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/golang-dev/kDoD7hIYCPw
